articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Song Sok Hwan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Song Sok Hwan 
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Song Sok Hwan, vice-minister of Culture who is winner of Order of Kim Il Sung and People's Artist, on Wednesday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: NDC Inspection Group Reveals Truth behind Yonphyong Shelling
articles.content:
NDC Inspection Group Reveals Truth behind Yonphyong Shelling
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The inspection group of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK in the first installment of the statement issued on Nov. 2 last year scientifically and fairly disclosed before the world that the sunk Cheonan ship case was the most hideous conspiratorial case in the history of the nation faked up by the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors.
					 In the subsequent period, experts of south Korea conducted 11 tests including a precision analysis of the process of the formation of absorptive on the hull of the ship and torpedo parts with the help of a scanning tunneling microscope. These tests led to flatly refuting the investigation results presented by south Korea.
					
					 Shell pieces on which flower-shape white substances are attached were found in the propelling body of the torpedo which was produced as overwhelming evidence proving the ship sinking. This proved that the propelling body had long been under water, not for 1-2 months. The puppet Defence Ministry hastily removed the shell pieces only to become people's laughing stock.
					
					 An officer who had been hired for a search operation in the waters where the incident took place was proved to have met death during the rescue operation of a U.S. submarine, increasing the suspicions about the clash between "Cheonan and the U.S. submarine." More facts are being brought to light to probe the truth behind the above-said charade.
					
					 It has already been known that more than 70 percent of the south Koreans said they were skeptical about the "story about the north's involvement in the Cheonan case" while the rest do not believe it or remain doubtful about it. 
					
					 The DPRK proposed the U.S. and south Korea conducting a joint investigation into the case after bringing relevant evidence to Panmunjom if they can not receive the inspection group of the NDC of the DPRK. But they have not yet responded to this bold and magnanimous proposal. Even a mere child can guess their ulterior motive.
					
					 However, the group of traitors of south Korea is making far-fetched assertions in a bid to exploit the already-bankrupt Cheonan case for escalating confrontation with the DPRK. This group is making futile efforts to shift the blame for the Yonphyong Island shelling on to the DPRK.
					
					 South Korea's delegates walked out of the conference room in the eyes of the north side's delegates when preliminary talks for the high-ranking north-south military talks were held on Feb. 8 and 9. But the south side floated the misinformation that the north side's delegates unilaterally walked out of the conference room. It is clear from this fact that the above-said group may cook up whatever it likes.
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling was a planned provocation aimed to trigger off a direct military clash against the Korean People's Army through a reckless preemptive attack. Through this the group sought to play down its crime and push the north-south relations to the brink of war as the Cheonan case was branded as a hideous conspiratorial case, making it impossible for it to escape the bitter domestic and foreign public accusation and denunciation.
					
					 The Cheonan case was the initial provocation to put overall military pressure on the DPRK in conspiracy with foreign forces while the Yonphyong shelling was the second planned provocation to ignite a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors recorded last year as a year of confrontation and conflict. In the new year, too, it is free to let loose a whole string of reckless remarks falsifying truth, persistently using the two cases for stoking confrontation between fellow countrymen. Under this situation the inspection group of the NDC decided to disclose the truth behind the Yonphyong Island shelling.
						
					
					1. Truth behind the Yonphyong Island Shelling 
						
					
					 Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea covers 6.8 square kilometers and its circumference is about 18 kilometers.
					
					 This small island has been widely known for the diversity of fishes and their abundance and become an object of envy by foreigners. This island, however, has turned into an advance base for aggression against the DPRK as huge marine corps and artillery forces are deployed by the south Korean puppet warmongers.
					
					 After amassing huge strike means on five islands in the West Sea of Korea including Yonphyong Island, south Korea watched for an opportunity of provocation while working out a firing plan of artillery pieces and flying corps of the puppet army for the defence of the "northern limit line." But it could not put it into practice in face of the toughest stand taken by the army of the DPRK and strong public opinion inside and outside Korea.
					
					 On Nov. 22 last year when Hoguk exercises targeted against the DPRK was at its height across south Korea, the puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff crafted a plan to bombard the territorial waters of the DPRK side on Nov. 23 and 24 from waters off Yonphyong Island.
					
					 The army of the DPRK, prompted by its hope to avert a military conflict in the sensitive waters and preserve peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, sent a telephone message to the puppet military at 8:00 on Nov. 23.
					
					 The message called for immediately canceling the reckless plan for shelling at the territorial waters of the DPRK side. It also warned in strong terms that in case south Korea defies this, it will face a resolute physical counterattack by the army of the DPRK and that it will be held wholly responsible for all the ensuing consequences.
					
					 South Korea, however, opened fire at the territorial waters of the DPRK by mobilizing artillery pieces deployed on Yonphyong Island.
					
					 Yonphyong Island, once home to peaceable inhabitants, thus turned into a base for preemptive military provocation and could not escape a deserved punishment.
					
					 The merciless physical counterattack on the positions of the puppet army on the island proved once again that the strong revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu did not make an empty declaration when it said that it would never pardon anyone intruding even a bit into the territorial waters and air and territory of the DPRK over which its sovereignty is exercised.
					
					 There is no house owner who will allow a robber to go on rampage and no army of any country who will allow warmongers to make a preemptive attack on its inviolable territorial waters. 
					
					 It was due to the group of traitors keen on confrontation with fellow countrymen that peaceful waters turned into a theatre of military conflict all of a sudden. 
					
					Fortunately, more than 1,300 islanders remained unhurt because they all went to the seaside opposite the firing positions to gather shellfishes.
					
					 The warmongers, however, went so sordid as to try to beat back the counterstrike by the DPRK by using the inhabitants as "human shields." They even did not inform the inhabitants of the warning message from the DPRK.
					
					 As for "civilian casualties", they were a few civilians enlisted in the armed forces. They were in the barracks of the puppet army. Had they not entered the barracks, they would not have met death.
					
					 Far from drawing a due lesson from its piteous plight, the group of traitors opted for expanding the shelling, crying out for so-called "retaliation" and "punishment."
					
					 The group of traitors carried out a massive replacement of military brasshats including the defense minister with hawkish guys and bolstered huge troops of the three services in and around Yonphyong Island. After clamping an emergency alert they fired bullets and shells from the area of the island for more than one hour on Dec. 20.
					
					 They secretly changed the waters and targets to be shelled for fear of the second and third counterstrike by the army of the DPRK. They also used the shells that had been left unused during the island shelling incident a month ago.
					
					 The army of the DPRK did not feel any need to respond to this clumsy firing conducted by the coward military for a propaganda purpose to save its face. 
					
					 Had the group of traitors fired even a shell on the territorial waters of the DPRK side, not only those islands from which shells were fired but also Seoul would have turned to a sea of fire.
					
					 
					
					2. Yonphyong Island Shelling: Extension of Systematic Provocation to DPRK
						
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling was an extension of the military provocations that have been systematically escalated up to this date since the publication of the Korean Armistice Agreement in 1953.
					
					 After sustaining a bitter defeat in the three-year war aimed to stifle the DPRK in its cradle, the puppet group of south Korea flatly denied the conclusion of the AA and worked in every way to scrap and render it invalid while crying out for "separate northward advance".
					
					 These moves were vividly proved by its acts in waters around the five islands in the West Sea on which a maritime military demarcation line was not set at the time of concluding the AA. These islands are geographically close to the coast of the DPRK side.
					
					 South Korea tried hard to put its plan of "separate northward advance" into practice while committing abduction and murder of peaceable fishermen, armed attacks on the area of the DPRK side and other crimes with the waters around the islands as a springboard.
					
					 The military provocations in waters of the West Sea of Korea and other areas were handled as the top agenda item at a meeting of the Military Armistice Commission after the conclusion of the AA. This proves the gravity of the military provocations in these waters at that time.
					
					 Due to the south Korean puppet army the waters in the West Sea turned into an advance base for the provocation of a war against the DPRK and a dispute-ridden waters fraught with the constant danger of confrontation and conflict between the north and the south.
					
					 South Korea escalated military provocations in the waters even in the 1960s, 70s and 80s in the wake of the 1950s. In the 1990s they developed into military conflicts too dangerous to put under control.
					
					 An example of this was the first West Sea skirmish in June 1999. 
					
					 At that time the U.S. and its allies' war against Yugoslavia was drawing to an end. South Korea set the DPRK as a target and the West Sea as an ignition point for the second Korean war. Then it buckled to carrying out the "operational plan to provoke the north".
					
					 The puppet warmongers of south Korea amassed two large destroyers, 20 clippers, more than 40 combatant ships of various types including tank landing ship, guard ship, supply ship, rescue ship as well as marine corps in waters around Yonphyong Island. They recklessly preempted firing at the ships of the DPRK side on routine guard duties.
					
					 After failing to make the first West Sea skirmish an ignition point for an all-out war, the puppet military warmongers sparked off the second armed conflict in the waters in 2002 when the hot wind of reconciliation and unity swept the peninsula more furiously than before.
					
					 In the subsequent period the puppet forces annually escalated the intrusions into the maritime guard line of the DPRK side in a planned way and triggered the third West Sea skirmish in 2009 only to disclose that they sought to use the waters around Yonphyong Island as an advance base for provoking a war against the DPRK.
					
					 After the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors came to power, the number of intrusions into the territorial waters of the DPRK side sharply increased. Last year alone it infiltrated ships into them on over 600 occasions under the pretext of "intercepting fishing boats" or coping with the routine operation of the ships of the navy of the DPRK.
					
					 All the facts prove that the Yonphyong Island shelling was by no means an accidental case but a product of protracted confrontation with fellow countrymen incited by the successive puppet warmongers and a direct revelation of the systematic extension of their military provocations.
						
					
					3. Criminal Aim Sought by Group of Traitors through Yonphyong Island Shelling
						
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling perpetrated by the south Korean group of traitors was a grave military provocation committed as an extension of the Cheonan case.
					
					 The case faked up by the group by sacrificing innocent soldiers for confrontation with the DPRK on March 26 last year turned out to be more unfavorable to the group as the days go by. The "results of investigation", announced by it twice to prove that the case "was linked with the north," were full of doubts, sparking off bitterer ridicule and criticism at home and abroad.
					
					 The first installment of the statement issued by the NDC inspection group revealing the truth behind the Cheonan case in the eyes of the world brought into bold relief the true colors of the tricksters who faked up the case. The U.S. and the group of traitors found no word to refute it. The tricksters worked hard to seek a way for tiding over the unfavorable situation.
					
					 The "bright idea" that came to the minds of the U.S. and the group of traitors was to fire shells into the waters under the DPRK control in a bid to induce its army to take a countermeasure and drive the north-south relations to the brink of war.
					
					 To this end, the south Korean group of traitors fired bullets and shells into the waters of the DPRK side despite its repeated strong warnings.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors sought a sinister aim in committing shelling from Yonphyong Island.
					
					 The shelling was aimed to persistently maintain its stand of preserving the illegal "northern limit line", first of all.
					
					 It is well known to the world that the "northern limit line" is a brigandish line unilaterally drawn inside the inviolable waters of the DPRK by the U.S. imperialist aggression forces present in south Korea under the berets of the "UN forces".
					
					 The U.S. imperialists felt extremely tired after sustaining an unprecedented defeat in the Korean War in July 1953. They let Clark, the then commander of the "UN forces", set the NLL, so-called Clark line, in the waters of the West Seat of Korea in a bid to check traitor Syngman Rhee's reckless attempt at "separate northern expedition" and prevent a war which might reoccur according to it and, at the same time, bar south Korean fishermen from going to the northern half of Korea.
					
					 The line is the "final line for blocking the way to the north" and the "limit line for banning the sailing of boats to the north" unilaterally drawn by Clark, commander of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, to meet the U.S. self-righteous interests.
					
					 Henry Kissinger, U.S. secretary of State in 1975, referring in a diplomatic message to the illegality of the NLL, said that the NLL was unilaterally set and it was not accepted by north Korea. This is in wanton violation of international law as the line was unilaterally drawn in the open sea, he added.
					
					 The U.S. ambassador to south Korea in December 1973 expressed deep concern by claiming that in case an incident occurs in the waters along the NLL, south Korea and the U.S. would be blamed by majority countries for doing wrongs. As seen above, the U.S. and its satellites openly admitted the illegality of the line.
					
					 That was why the U.S. imperialists did not inform the DPRK side of the line, far from opening it to the public though many years have passed since then.
					
					 The voices ridiculing the NLL as a "hot potato" which is poor in logic and serious in practice are endlessly heard from among the political, academic and public circles of south Korea as it was unilaterally set.
					
					 Moreover, the NLL is quite contrary to the Paragraph 13 B of the Korean Armistice Agreement stipulating that the island groups of Paengyong-Do, Taechong-Do, Sochong-Do, Yonpyong-Do and U-Do shall remain under the military control of the commander of the "UN forces" and all other islands and waters under the military control of the DPRK side. It is in total breach of the norms of maritime boundary stipulated by the International Law of the Sea including the respect for the right to 12 mile territorial waters.
					
					 Had the NLL been set according to the recognized legal norms and usage, the south Korean group of traitors would not have felt the need to "preserve" the line with so much effort. 
					
					 The puppet forces preempted shelling from Yonphyong Island where the military confrontation between the north and the south remains acute though south Korea has so many islands. Their real intention was to "preserve the NLL" whose existence is at increasing peril day by day.
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling was also designed to spark off military conflicts in the West Sea of Korea in a bid to nullify the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, its action program, the precious gains common to the nation, and turn the waters into an eternal theatre of confrontation and conflict.
					
					 It is the unanimous aspiration and desire of all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad to make the waters of the West Sea of Korea peace waters and ensure the common interests and prosperity of the nation.
					
					 A lot of cases of military confrontation and clash in the past caused painful casualties and the economic losses, and damages done to fishermen in the north and the south amounted to astronomical figures.
					
					 The adoption of the historic two declarations, the proposal for setting the special zone for peace and cooperation in the West Sea for the co-prosperity of the nation and the adoption of an agreement on providing a military guarantee for setting common fishing waters and peace waters reflected the unanimous desire of all Koreans.
					
					 But the expectation and hope of the Koreans to see the disputed waters in the West Sea of Korea which brought disgrace and pain of the nation turn into peace and prosperity waters adding to the pride and joy of the nation have not been translated into reality.
					
					No sooner had traitor Lee Myung Bak, steeped in antagonism toward the DPRK, become the master of "Chongwadae" than such hideous policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen as "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars" was adopted as a "state policy." He began to scrap the historic north-south agreements which had already been under implementation, blustering that he would approach the north-south relations with a "ruler of pragmatism", not with a "yardstick of ideology."
					
					 The group of traitors totally turned down even the proposal for preventing military confrontation and conflict between the north and the south and ensuring the common interests and prosperity of the nation under the pretext of "sympathy of the people" and "financial burden".
					
					 It hatched a sinister plot to eliminate everything step by step after classifying the inter-Korean agreements, the precious gains common to the nation, into a category which should be implemented on a priority basis, a category to be implemented at the final phase and a category which should not be implemented. This drove the implementation of the historic October 4 declaration to a total suspension, brought the north-south relations back to those of confrontation in the era of the Cold War and turned the West Sea again into a theatre of military confrontation and conflict, an advance base for igniting a war against the DPRK and a position from which to start an attack on it.
					
					 No wonder, the people in south Korea, commenting on the Yonphyong Island shelling in which the military clash spilled over to the land from the sea, deplored that such tragic incident would not have occurred if the October 4 declaration had been implemented.
					
					 The said shelling was also aimed at plugging the U.S., its master, deeper into its scenario for invading the DPRK.
					
					 After setting it as the primary target to keep the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea for an indefinite period, traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea did not hesitate to commit the thrice-cursed treachery to "tighten the alliance" with the U.S. But he could not settle the issue of postponing the transfer of the right to control wartime operations as he intended.
					
					 This was because the decision to hand over the right to control wartime operations to the puppet army till April 17, 2012 according to the south Korea-U.S. "summit" in September 2006 was made public to have been officially agreed at the bilateral "defense ministers talks" in February 2007.
					
					 Driven by the urgent need to create exceptional "uneasy security" for the pretext for the U.S. forces' permanent presence in south Korea, the group of traitors was repeatedly closeted, finally cooking up the case of Cheonan warship sinking at night under the territorial waters in peacetime. 
					
					 The group staged big joint naval exercises one after another under that pretext and introduced nuclear carrier flotilla of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces into the narrow waters of the West Sea of Korea. It then held renegotiations for postponing the transfer of the right to wartime operation control as it planned and succeeded in extending the hand-over time for additional three years and seven months.
					
					 Enraged people rose up in protest against this pro-American and treacherous act across south Korea. Upset by this, the group of traitors needed the second Cheonan case, i.e. a shocking case to keep the "uneasy security".
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling was committed under meticulous plan for this purpose.
					
					 In order to put this plan into practice, the group committed two adventurous military provocations at the time when 2010 was running out. It is misusing the case of Yonphyong Island shelling to escalate confrontation with the DPRK in the new year, too.
						
					
					4. Who was behind the Yonphyong Island shelling?
						
					
					 When the group of traitors perpetrated shelling from the Yonphyong Island one after another despite strong protest and denunciation at home and abroad, the attention of the world was focused on the every movement of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces present in south Korea under the mask of the "UN Command".
					
					 This was because the U.S. imperialists, the real master of the command holding the right to "control wartime operations" in south Korea and tasked to implement and oversee the Korean Armistice Agreement, zealously backed and patronized the military provocations of the puppet forces, far from preventing them. 
					
					 When the group announced the plan for second shelling from the island, pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war, the U.S. imperialists let the command fully support the plan, terming the projected exercise one to be staged legitimately in observance of the AA. Moreover, they declared that they would send at least 20 persons belonging to the UN forces to the island to assist the group in such fields as communications and medical care so that it would go ahead with the exercise as planned.
					
					 Lurking behind this was their sinister aim to paint any military conflict in these sensitive waters as confrontation between the army of the DPRK and the "UN Command," not anything happening between the north and the south. 
					
					  The U.S. imperialists misled public opinion by advertising the military provocation of the group as "legitimate shelling exercise" in a bid to make the military conflict between the two sides a fait accompli and get the U.S. aggression forces in south Korea fully ready to involve themselves in it.
					
					 There was no clash between the two sides as the army of the DPRK paid no heed to such vicious military provocation as taking revenge after being hit hard. But the U.S. imperialists staged large-scale joint naval maneuvers after rapidly dispatching "George Washington" nuclear carrier flotilla made up of cruisers, destroyers, nuclear submarines, landing craft, etc. dozens of carrier-based aircraft, F-15 and F-16 fighters as main forces to the narrow waters of the West Sea of Korea as they planned. 
					
					In succession they sent more than 10,000 troops of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, a nuclear carrier flotilla and over 150 fighters to the waters off Okinawa in Japan to stage the largest-ever joint military exercises in coordinated operations with 34,000 troops of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces", 40 warships and 250 planes. They even invited south Korean puppet troops to participate in the exercises as "observers".
					
					 Timing to coincide with this, they invited top class servants of south Korea and Japan to Washington for a confab to discuss "a joint counter-action" against the DPRK and "close cooperation".
					
					 Their military moves in the wake of the Cheonan case and the Yonphyong Island shelling were aimed to wind up the setting up of the structure of military confrontation in Northeast Asia under the pretext of the escalating tension on the peninsula and, furthermore, realize their wild ambition for world domination. 
					
					 As already disclosed, the U.S. imperialists' Asia-Pacific policy is the core and mainstay of their strategy for world domination in the 21st century. 
					
					 In order to realize this strategy, they are attaching great importance to the above-said region where big powers are concentrated, to the Korean Peninsula, in particular, as it is of great importance geologically and strategically.
					
					 It is their judgment that it is impossible to dominate the Asian continent nor is it possible to lay a military siege to Eurasia unless the whole of Korea is put under their control. So they calculate that they can easily dominate the world if they seize the Korean Peninsula and overpower the big powers in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 But the reality was quite contrary to what they intended. 
					
					 They ran the whole gamut of means such as economic isolation and suffocation, psychological warfare and military threat to stifle Korean-style socialism. But they suffered repeated setbacks. On the contrary, their influence and right to domination weakened in this region due to their domestic and foreign environment and crisis. 
					
					 They felt the urgent need to exercise influence backed by military muscle and this required an appropriate justification. 
					
					 Hence, they instigated the south Korean group of traitors to fabricate the Cheonan case. Later they openly allowed the group to "take counter-action by exercising the right to self-defense" and "amend the rules of belligerency."  They egged the group on to perpetrate shelling from Yonphyong Island, even providing "information about the north" and giving prompt support with latest military hardware including F-22 Raptor fighters. 
					
					 What merits particular attention in their moves after the Cheonan case and the Yonphyong Island shelling last year is that they are channeling all efforts into establishing the structure of military confrontation in Asia. 
					
					 The moves to knock into shape a triangular military alliance involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea which had been pushed forward from long ago are aimed to militarily dominate the region by mobilizing not only the U.S. imperialist aggression forces but Japan SDF in case of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula. It is their scenario to form a new military bloc in the region and expand the U.S.-led military blocs to the east and the west and then throughout the world. 
					
					 The Asian type NATO is more dangerous than NATO, in actuality. The issue of establishing a missile defense system has not been officially stipulated in NATO and it has no operational plan for invading and occupying other countries, in particular. 
					
					 But the above-said triangular military alliance includes the above-said issue and plan. It is more aggressive and interventionist in its nature than NATO. Means and methods of operations are more specified in the alliance. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists staged an emergency huddle under the pretext of "taking a joint counter-action" against the Yonphyong Island incident at which they agreed with south Korea to take a counter-action by hurling  puppet warmongers as a shock brigade to counter somebody's "local provocation" while providing support to them from behind and mobilizing even the Japanese reactionaries. This indicates that they are set to ignite a war against the DPRK by mobilizing multi-national forces. 
					
					 All these facts are enough to reveal once again that the U.S. imperialists were behind the above-said two cases. 
					
					 
					
					5. Bitter Lessons Drawn from Yonphyong Island Shelling 
						
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling that occurred owing to the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors taught serious lessons to the Korean nation and other world people desirous of peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The first lesson is that it is necessary to cross off the illegal "northern limit line" and set the extension of MDL in the West Sea of Korea in a fair way at an early date. 
					
					 The viewpoint and stand on the "northern limit line" can serve as a touchstone distinguishing those standing for peace in the West Sea from those opposed to it. 
					
					 From a military viewpoint, a curtain of bilateral military conflicts was already raised in the West Sea of Korea. Any armed clash may lead to an all-out war, seriously threatening not only the destiny of the Korean nation but also world peace. 
					
					 The "northern limit line" is a ghostlike line which can convince no one because it was unilaterally drawn in a brigandish way without a bilateral agreement, to say nothing of the requirements of the international law of the sea, the principle of respecting the opponent's 12 mile territorial waters, requirement of AA and the "law of the sea" of south Korea. 
					
					 No wonder, even the U.S. imperialists drew the north-south "imaginary boundary" in the West Sea of Korea further southward than the "northern limit line" on the basis of the principle of equidistance stipulated by the international law of the sea. At that time they were distributing Korean maps to the participants in the UN conference on the law of the sea which was held in the U.S.
					
					  After the Yonphyong Island shelling, not only the broad international community but also Americans became increasingly vocal calling for re-fixing the "northern limit line". 
					
					 Selig Harrison, director for Asia Program of the Center for International Policy of the U.S. who is an expert on Korean affairs, said that it is very easy to solve the West Sea conflict between south and north of Korea. The U.S. has to reset the "northern limit line", an extension of MDL in the sea, in the dispute-ridden area a little southward, he added. He went on to say that the U.S. has the right to reset the "northern limit line" as it was granted by the UNSC the right to nominate the commander of the UN forces in south Korea in November 1950. The Obama administration must discuss the issue of setting the new boundary in the West Sea of Korea with both sides of Korea, but must not grant the south Korean regime the right to refuse a new boundary if an agreement on it is reached, he pointed out. 
					
					 The broad international community including political, social and academic circles is becoming increasingly assertive that the U.S. should come out to remove the "northern limit line".
					
					 This represents the world opinion that it is none other than the U.S. which should set the new boundary in the West Sea with responsibility to ensure peace in the waters of the West Sea of Korea. It is the view of the world people that the U.S. imperialists sowed the seed of armed clash and dispute in the waters and the south Korean group of traitors abused it for invasion of the DPRK and confrontation with it. 
					
					 The reality proves that a top priority task for averting conflicts and disputes and achieving durable peace in the waters is to correctly set the boundary there. 
					
					 Another lesson is that the dispute-torn waters should be turned into a peace zone until a new extension of MDL is set there. 
					
					 It is the common will of the Korean nation to set up peace waters to make the West Sea a sea of national prosperity, not the one of confrontation between fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The historic October 4 declaration on which the north and the south agreed reflected this will. 
					
					 This declaration stipulated the principled matters for putting an end to the relations of military hostility, defusing tension and ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula. In particular, it provided the best way for setting up the special zone for peace and cooperation in the West Sea and fixing a joint fishing zone and peace waters.
					
					 Both sides held the second defence ministerial talks and general-level military talks for the implementation of the October 4 declaration, at which they agreed to take practical measures to prevent conflicts and secure peace in the West Sea.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK put forward the realistic and principled proposals to implement this agreement. 
					
					 They included landmark proposals calling on both sides to give up all their assertions from broad mind, handle the West Sea conflict on the basis of the already existing north-south agreements, AA and demand of internationally accepted laws, until a new military demarcation line is set in the West Sea of Korea, and fix the peace waters and joint fishing zone. 
					
					 However, the south Korean group of traitors scrapped valuable agreements of the Korean nation. As a result, the seed of conflicts and disputes still remains in the waters, becoming a potential flash point of an all-out war. 
					
					 From the outset it paid no heed to the lessons of the past West Sea incidents and the principled ways for solving them put forward by the DPRK. It only worked with blood-shot eyes to maintain the illegal "northern limit line" and ignite a war against the north. 
					
					 The past history showed that if the south Korean authorities truly hope for peace on the Korean Peninsula, they should give up their stand of preserving the "northern limit line" and set a new extension of the Military Demarcation Line in the West Sea of Korea. And it showed that they should buckle down to putting into practice the proposal for setting the special zone for peace and cooperation in the West Sea advanced by the DPRK till the new extension of the MDL is set. It also proved that those opposed to this are precisely harassers of peace and provocateurs of war.
					
					 There is a saying that the past is the "lamp" lighting the present and future.
					
					 It is self-evident that if the north and the south do not pull themselves out of the mire of confrontation, sticking to the inglorious past, they can never pave a wide avenue of peace and prosperity, much less achieving peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 Whoever truly wants the improved north-south relations and values peace on the peninsula, whether they live in the north and the south and abroad, should neither call into question the Cheonan case and the Yonphyong Island shelling any longer nor put them up as any precondition.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the Cheonan case has nothing to do with the DPRK. It is the immutable truth.
					
					 The Yonphyong Island shelling would not have occurred if the south Korean group of traitors had not preempted shelling in the waters of the DPRK side.
					
					 For over six decades since the division of Korea, the army of the DPRK has never taken any physical countermeasure against all forms of shelling drills which had been staged in the areas and waters of south Korea.
					
					 If the group of traitors tries to link the Cheonan case with the DPRK in a far-fetched way and shift the blame for the Yonphyong Island shelling onto it while turning blind eyes to this stark reality, this will only prove that the group seeks only the escalated confrontation with fellow countrymen and the deteriorated north-south relations.
					
					 The army of the DPRK proposed "On halting military actions which can be recognized as provocation of the other party" as an agenda of the recent preliminary talks for the opening of the north-south highly-level military talks. This was prompted by the steadfast will to tide over the present developments in a fair and aboveboard way at an early date, the developments which resulted from the distrust and antagonism pent up between the north and the south for a long period.
					
					 The recent north-south military dialogue was held with much effort amid the great concern and expectation of the people at home and abroad. The south Korean group of traitors, however, persisted in peddling the two cases there because it sought confrontation and war, not dialogue and peace. As a result, the talks naturally came to a rupture.
					
					 It is too natural that broad strata of south Korea are becoming increasingly concerned and worried that if the present authorities turn their back on the DPRK's proposal for unconditioned dialogue and rush headlong into one-sided confrontation, calling into question the two incidents, this will entail miserable consequences of swamping the whole land of south Korea as the Cheonan warship and turning it into a wormwood field like Yonphyong Island.
					
					 But the group of traitors prolonging their remaining days through sycophancy toward the U.S. and escalated confrontation with fellow countrymen is working hard to find a way out in keeping the phase of confrontation under the pretext of the two cases.
					
					 The further the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean group of traitors "blame" the DPRK for the two cases, the more saliently it will reveal their ugly colors as anti-DPRK confrontational fanatics and their effrontery of confusing right and wrong.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will continue doing their utmost to shatter the vicious moves of the worst confrontational elements in the world, improve the north-south relations and ensure peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Guyana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Guyana 
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Bharrat Jagdeo, President of Guyana, on the 41st anniversary of proclamation of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana.
					 The message wished him greater success in the work for development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Malaysian Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Malaysian Ambassador 
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun had a talk with outgoing Malaysian Ambassador to the DPRK Rahimi Bin Harun on Wednesday.

articles.title: Palestinian Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador Gives Reception
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, arranged a reception at his embassy Wednesday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Palestinian embassy were on hand. 
					
					 The ambassador noted at the reception that Kim Jong Il is leading the general advance for opening the gate to a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The friendly relations between the two countries, provided by President Yasser Arafat and eternal President Kim Il Sung, are growing stronger day by day under the guidance of Chief of the Palestinian National Authority Mahmoud Abbas and leader Kim Jong Il, he said 
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said that the Palestinian friends join the Korean people in significantly celebrating Kim Jong Il's birthday every year. This is an expression of their deep respect and reverence for the leader, he added. 
					
					 He declared that the Korean people would invariably support the Palestinian people's just cause of retaking their national rights and founding an independent and sovereign state with Kuds as its capital.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Liberation Tower and Cemetery of Soviet Army
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Liberation Tower and Cemetery of Soviet Army
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower on Wednesday on the occasion of the Day of Defenders of the Motherland.
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremony were Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and Military Attache Aleksei Bartusov and other staff members of the Russian embassy and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 After a wreath in the name of the Russian embassy was placed before the tower the participants paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet army. 
					
					 They also placed a wreath and bouquets before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet army in Sadong District, Pyongyang on the same day.

articles.title: Gifts from Chinese Businessmen
articles.content:
Gifts from Chinese Businessmen
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from Chinese businessmen on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The gifts came from Gao Jinliang, chairman and managing director of the Jinpei Century Investment Group Co., Ltd., and the chairman of the China Jilin International Economic and Technical Corporation.
					
					 They were separately conveyed to an official concerned of the DPRK working in China by the two businessmen.

articles.title: Symposium on Stockbreeding-Agricultural Production Cycle Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Stockbreeding-Agricultural Production Cycle Held
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A symposium on the stockbreeding-agricultural production cycle was held at the Grand People's Study House on Feb. 22 and 23.
					 Speeches were made there under such themes as "The stockbreeding-agricultural production cycle is the best system for promoting the development of animal husbandry" and "The stockbreeding-agricultural production cycle is the basic way for ensuring the profitability of animal husbandry". 
					
					The speakers noted that General Secretary Kim Jong Il clarified the essence of the food production cycle and the ways for introducing this system while giving field guidance to co-op farms and modern stockbreeding bases across the country. And they introduced in detail the successes gained in this work.
					
					 There were also a public presentation of scientific and technological papers and an exhibition of achievements.
					
					 60 odd papers on scientific research and technological innovation gains were introduced at the presentation and 70 odd kinds of new technological products presented to the exhibition. Meanwhile, a lecture on science and technology was given during the symposium.
					
					 In the period there was a brisk campaign for spread of scientific and technological knowledge and exchange of new technologies.

articles.title: One More Ancient Tomb with Murals Unearthed
articles.content:
One More Ancient Tomb with Murals Unearthed
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Archaeologists of the DPRK discovered a tomb with mural paintings dating back to the Koguryo dynasty in the area of Ryonggang of the country.
					 They are researchers of the Archaeology Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 The tomb was unearthed on a low hill in the seat of Okdo-ri, Ryonggang County, and confirmed to date back to the period from the late 4th century to the early 5th century.
					
					 This earth-covered stone tomb, placed in north-south direction, consists of a pathway leading to the main chamber, front chamber and alcove dented like closet on its right and left walls, a passage in between and the main chamber. 
					
					 The main chamber at present is 2.85m long, 2.83m wide and 2.28m high. It looks like a ground structure as its every wall corner is decorated with pillar, head space and beams. 
					
					 Especially conspicuous in it are murals diverse in theme and rich in content.
					
					 Depicted in the mural on the north wall are a couple and attendants in beautiful dress inside rectangular room with raised curtain. This shows indoor life of the master of the tomb. 
					
					 On the east wall there are pictures of seven males and females, guessed to be singers, and nine dancers. This gracious mural painting well shows the features and level of the Koguryo singing and dancing arts.  
					
					 Seen on the west mural are hunting people, and there are splendid patterns on the upper part of the walls. 
					
					 These tomb mural paintings will be greatly helpful to the research into the Koguryo culture as they are precious relics showing the excellent architecture, pictorial art and custom at that time.

articles.title: Amino Acid Micronutrient Composite Fertilizer Developed
articles.content:
Amino Acid Micronutrient Composite Fertilizer Developed
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK developed amino acid micronutrient composite fertilizer.
					 This fertilizer was obtained through a chemical combination of dozens of micronutrient elements extracted from Kumgang medical stones found in abundance in the country and rare earth elements and protein obtained from feather of chicken and duck and other animals left unused.
					
					 The fertilizer can be used as seed disinfectant.
					
					 It helps promote the growth of plant roots and facilitate the activity of plant ferments and enrich the content of chlorophyll. It is efficacious for preventing various diseases including rice damping-off and blight.
					
					 The economic effectiveness of this fertilizer has been proved on many cooperative farms including those in South Phyongan Province, North Hwanghae Province and Pyongyang.
					
					 When this fertilizer was applied, the rate of germination of seed increased 7 percent on an average and the germination took place many days earlier than before.
					
					 The grain yield in the paddy and non-paddy fields to which the fertilizer was applied showed a 10-20 percent increase per hectare as compared with those to which the fertilizer was not applied.
					
					 The per hectare yield in the fields under vegetables went up 20-40 percent.

articles.title: Production of Heavy Rails Set to Jump
articles.content:
Production of Heavy Rails Set to Jump 
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex in the DPRK is stepping up the arrangements for boosting the production of heavy rails. 
					 It is energetically pushing forward the work to hit its clear targets to develop varieties of structural steel for the production of rails with locally available resources and raw materials, round off the rolling process and establish a new Juche iron making center, etc. 
					
					 At present the project for constructing an industrial structure and the assembling of a facility are making progress. 
					
					 As a result, a technological preparation for producing heavy rails has been completed while the overhauling of equipment and a project for reconstructing a production building have been wound up in the main to lay a solid foundation for production. 
					
					 The Ministry of Machine-building Industry and the Ministry of Construction and Building Materials Industry and other related units are helping the complex. 
					
					 The complex was provided with a large quantity of scrap iron by North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 A research group of Kim Chaek University of Technology conducted more than 30 tests on iron melting and at least 100 coupons, deciding upon the rational composition of steel for rails. 
					
					 A signal turn is expected to take place in boosting the production of heavy rails thanks to the painstaking efforts made by the complex and related units.

articles.title: Mass-based Performing Activities Brisk
articles.content:
Mass-based Performing Activities Brisk 
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The art groups of employees of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and the February 8 Vinalon Complex gave performances at the People's Palace of Culture here, drawing capacity audiences.
					 They staged colorful numbers of high cognitional and educational values as they truthfully represented the spirit of the workers who are making a breakthrough in the drive to build an economic power.
					
					 Mass-based performing activities are a unique art style in the DPRK imbuing people with revolutionary enthusiasm and optimism.
					
					 Mass-based performing activities are diverse in their organization. 
					
					 These activities are brisk in the army with a company as a unit while they are regularly conducted by art groups of family members of servicepersons. Performing activities are also brisk at institutions, industrial establishments and rural villages.
					
					 Performances are also given by family members of workers and office workers.
					
					 These performing activities are often introduced by TV and other media.
					
					 Noteworthy in mass-based performing activities is that thematic contents, styles and methods of performing activities conducted by soldiers serve as examples to be followed by the art groups of society. 
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il has pursued a unique policy of music. Whenever he visited KPA units and industrial establishments, he spared time to watch art performances given by them and highly appreciated their success.

articles.title: Mt. Kumgang Famous for Bio-diversity
articles.content:
Mt. Kumgang Famous for Bio-diversity
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Mt. Kumgang in Korea, a world famous mountain, is also widely known for its bio-diversity. 
					 There grow in the mountain indigenous plants of 112 species including Kumgang Stephanandra incisa and Kumgang bellflower, the only genus and species in the world. 
					
					 These plants account for about a quarter of the indigenous plants found on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 There are not a few animals which are regarded as those on the verge of extinction in Asia and the rest of the world. They include bears, otters, gorals, musk deer, black woodpeckers and Kumgang toads. There grow in the mountain polar alpine plants, multifarious mushrooms and butterflies of various species. 
					
					 Mt. Kumgang, therefore, can be called a sanctuary of important gene resources. 
					
					 The bio-diversity in Mt. Kumgang has been formed in the protracted course of evolution. 
					
					 The organism of every species plays its inherent role under this ecological system there.

articles.title: Koreans, Pioneer in Development of Printing Technology
articles.content:
Koreans, Pioneer in Development of Printing Technology
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Koreans invented metal type in the first half of the 12th century. They also developed lead type and typesetting, the first of their kinds in the world.
					 Koreans set up "Juja Printing House", type manufacturing and printing organ, in 1403, rapidly developing printing technology by mass-producing different kinds of metal types.
					
					 They were the first in the world to produce lead type in 1436.
					
					 They distributed types on copperplates before accurately fixing them. This printing technology gave an origin to the modern typesetting.
					
					 The True Record of the Ri Dynasty says in this regard: The sizes of the copperplate and types are so consistent with each other that hundreds of papers can be printed accurately in a day.
					
					 An exhibition called "History of Books" was held in Paris under the sponsorship of UNESCO in 1972.
					
					 The ancient book "Jikjisimgyong" on display there testified to the fact that Korea was the first to invent metal type and the printing technology was disseminated all over the world from Korea.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on Japan's Claim to Territory of Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on Japan's Claim to Territory of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Japan is getting evermore pronounced in its imprudent scheme to grab Tok islets, territory pertaining to Korea from time immemorial. 
					 Media of Japan are these days vying with each other to report that the number of citizens in Shimane Prefecture transferring their domicile to the islets is on the steady increase.
					
					 They assert that those citizens' transfer of domicile is a token of protest against the Japanese government which has not shown its positive stance toward "territorial dispute".
					
					 Lurking behind such actions is the Japanese reactionaries' crafty and insidious scheme to grab the islets at any cost by using the citizens as a shock brigade.
					
					 It is absurd to assert that the Japanese authorities have not taken an active hand in the issue of the islets so far.
					
					 Their active involvement is proven by the recent facts.
					
					 The Japanese authorities made public the "2010 defense white paper" stipulating that Tok islets belong to Japan. They also announced the "2010 diplomatic blue paper" which specifies Japan's "claim to Tok islets".
					
					 Japan's Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology officially adopted the "instruction manual" containing new high school curriculum guidelines, which states that the islets belong to Japan's territory. It also decided to write down Japan's "dominium over Tok islets" in all social subject textbooks for elementary schools since 2011.
					
					Earlier, the geographical institute of Japan backed by the Ministry of National Land and Communications announced that Tok islets are marked in the same color as Japan's territory on all the maps issued in Japan, 200,000-300,000 a year.
					
					 On February 22 there was an event for commemorating "Day of Takeshima (Tok islets)" in Shimane Prefecture. Isn't this a good example to show the government's involvement?
					
					 Tok islets are an ancestral territory pertaining to Korea. This has already been proven by the historical data and geographical and legal grounds.
					
					 Such being the hard fact, Japan insists on its "claim to the islets" of no validity, attempting to make them an object of dispute.
					
					 The international community is astonished at the infamy of Japan which seeks to grab Tok islets through its citizens' transfer of domicile though it is arguing with surrounding countries over territorial issues.
					
					 In the last century Japan occupied Korea for over 40 years and imposed untold misfortune, sufferings and disasters upon the Koreans in this period. It can never be allowed to dream of staging a comeback to Korea, coveting its inviolable territory.
					
					 Japan must stop at once its reckless attempt to grab the islets.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Fabrication of "Korea-Japan Protocol" under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Fabrication of "Korea-Japan Protocol" under Fire 
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists' fabrication of "Korea-Japan Protocol" was a hideous criminal act committed by them to invade Korea and colonize it in the past, say leading newspapers of the DPRK Wednesday in bylined articles carried 107 years since they cooked up the protocol.
					 Citing facts to clarify the course in which the protocol was fabricated by the Japanese imperialists, the article of Rodong Sinmun notes that the protocol was an illegal document as it was cooked up by them with power, threat and coercion involved.
					
					 The protocol provided the Japanese imperialists with legal conditions for turning Korea into their colony, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Japan is still talking about the "legality" of the sham "treaties" fabricated by the Japanese imperialists in a brigandish manner including the "Korea-Japan Protocol".
					
					 This is intolerable as it is an act of distorting and falsifying the historic truth and violating international law. What should not be overlooked is that the Japanese reactionary forces are letting loose a string of nonsense that the "'Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty' was an option of the Koreans" and "there were agreements with different countries of the world." They are justifying Japan's past crimes, denying and whitewashing them. This is a revelation of Japan's criminal scenario to dodge settlement of its past crimes and repeat the history of its aggression. 
					
					 Japan had better immediately stop its shameless distortion of the history and moves to stage a comeback to Korea and redeem its past wrongs as early as possible. 
					
					 Minju Joson in an article says that the Korean people will surely force Japan to redeem the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past without fail no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and how often the generation is replaced by a new one.

articles.title: Reckless Remark Aimed to Aggravate Tension
articles.content:
Reckless Remark Aimed to Aggravate Tension
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. Seventh Fleet said on Feb. 16 that the U.S. would continue to dispatch an aircraft carrier to the West Sea of Korea for joint military exercises with south Korea.
					 His remark is apparently aimed to aggravate the tension on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 Admittedly, the U.S. architected the warship "Cheonan" and Yonphyong Island incidents on the Korean peninsula last year and took them as an excuse to stage largest-ever joint naval exercises on the East and West Seas of Korea with nuclear carrier George Washington taking part in them.
					
					 The exercises were viewed as military threat to the DPRK and challenge to the public desire for peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 But the commander described the dispatch of the aircraft carrier as a contribution to the stability on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 His remark came when the U.S. and south Korea were going to start the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers, rendering the already acute situation more strained.

articles.title: US Okinawa Bases for Aggression on DPRK
articles.content:
US Okinawa Bases for Aggression on DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and Japan have turned Okinawa into military bases against the DPRK.
					The island houses some 40,000 U.S. troops and 60 military bases including the Kadena base with two 4,000m-long runways, the largest U.S. air force base in the Far East. Stationed on Kadena are tactical, strategic, naval and marine air forces.
					
					 The U.S., which used Okinawa as operation, supply and logistics bases in the Korean war (1950-1953), is increasing the island's military significance and function.
					
					 From the 1960s the Japanese government has considered the U.S. Okinawa bases as a deterrent for coping with emergency on the Korean peninsula. This fact was opened to the public recently through a diplomatic document.
					
					 The Okinawa-based U.S. forces are directing the spearhead of attack to the Korean peninsula.
					
					The main force is U.S. Marines numbering some 15,000. They have participated in almost joint military exercises between the U.S. and Japan, and between the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. regards Okinawa as frontline bases in Korea strategy.
					
					 Another main force is the 18th flying corps.
					
					 Kadena-based RC-135, EP-3, WC-135W and U-2 reconnaissance planes are keeping a close eye on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Japan's Preemptive Strike Strategy
articles.content:
Japan's Preemptive Strike Strategy
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Japan's military strategy has obviously turned to a preemptive strike one.
					 The "Self-Defense Forces" of Japan have been reorganized into offensive forces for overseas aggression.
					
					 The Ground "SDF" has some ten divisions with sophisticated combat equipment. The Maritime "SDF" has modern vessels, while the Air "SDF" is equipped with new-type aircraft. 
					
					 The "SDF" seeks even nuclear arms and aircraft carrier.
					
					 The fact shows that the Japanese armed forces have grown to be a regular, offensive army for overseas aggression, not for defense.
					
					 Japan adopted "law on special measures against terrorism" in 2001 to allow "SDF" to launch overseas operations.
					
					 In 2002 it adopted another law to move up the point of armed force use from "after undergoing aggression" to "when being attacked" or "when being likely to be attacked".
					
					 In the "defense programme guidelines" published in 2004, Japan expanded the scope of security to international security from home security. As a result, the mission of the "SDF" includes international emergency aid, UN peace-keeping operations, logistic support for the U.S. and "anti-terrorism activities".
					
					 The Japanese Strategy Forum, a think tank of the Japanese government, in its report in 2007 suggested that Japan possess missile strike capabilities for preemptive attack.
					
					 After a new version of the "law on special measures against terrorism" was passed through Diet in 2008, the Maritime "SDF" began logistic support activities on the Indian Ocean.
					
					 Japan's preemptive strike strategy shows that the country is forgetful of its war defeat in the last century.

articles.title: Russia-US Friction Expected in Nuclear Arms Reduction
articles.content:
Russia-US Friction Expected in Nuclear Arms Reduction
 Moscow, February 23 (KCNA) -- A Russian vice foreign minister told a recent press conference that an early withdrawal of tactical nuclear weapons by the United States from Europe would be favorable for confidence building between the two countries. 
					 His remark came after a new START (Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty) came into effect between Russia and the United States.
					
					 On Feb. 5 the Russian foreign minister and the U.S. state secretary exchanged ratification instruments of the new START on the sidelines of the Munich International Conference, effectuating the treaty.
					
					 News analysts are of the view that the two countries are obliged to reduce about a third of their nuclear arms, but the reduction does not mean a decrease of their strategic nuclear forces. It is also their opinion that the bilateral confrontation would not be eased with contradictions still existing in the security issue. 
					
					 The parliamentary ratification process revealed that a great divergence of opinion has existed between the two countries. Both parliaments attached supplementary articles to the treaty, quite different from each other, in the ratification process.
					
					 The United States has insisted on a missile defense (MD) system in Europe, alleging that it is nothing to do with strategic arms.
					
					 Meanwhile, Russia calls for setting up a regional MD system jointly with NATO, saying that it would be a sole way for solving contradictions over the MD system.
					
					 But the United States, in defiance of Russia's strong opposition, is persistently seeking MD system under the pretext of the treaty's no-binding preface. 
					
					 Russia, to cope with the U.S. MD system, is directing much effort to manufacturing sophisticated missiles.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Vow to Take Lead in Implementation of Joint Declarations
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Vow to Take Lead in Implementation of Joint Declarations
						
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration at a meeting on Feb. 18 reiterated their will to take the lead in the actions for implementing the inter-Korean joint declarations. 
					 The organization in a resolution accused the present authorities of bringing to naught all the achievements made in the June 15 era through the struggle for improving the south-north relations and achieving prosperity common to the nation, escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen and increasing the danger of war.
					
					 The youth and students will fight to the last in the van of the struggle for preserving and implementing the June 15 joint declaration, a milestone of national reunification, and the October 4 declaration, its action programme, the organization declared.
					
					 The youth and students will let the people know the justice of the reunification movement, conduct activities disclosing the "government's" moves against reunification and stage the struggle for the repeal of the "National Security Law," convinced that the implementation of the joint declarations is the only way for achieving reunification, peace and prosperity of the nation, it noted.
					
					 It declared that the youth and students would further intensify the actions for putting a halt to the dangerous war maneuvers for invading the north and achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Han Tok Su Held in Tokyo
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Han Tok Su Held in Tokyo 
						
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A memorial service was held in Tokyo on Feb. 21 in commemoration of the 10th anniversary of death of Han Tok Su, former chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, and other officials and compatriots and bereaved families of Han Tok Su. 
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Han. 
					
					 Ho Jong Man in his memorial address noted that Han Tok Su, holding the important post of chairman of Chongryon until the last moments of his life since the very day of its formation, firmly built Chongryon into an overseas compatriots' organization of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and set an example as a pioneer in the overseas compatriots' movement. This is the great feat performed by Han before the country and the nation, he added.
					
					 The speaker went on: 
					
					 Han Tok Su could glorify his life as a pioneer, an able organizer of the Koreans movement in Japan and representative of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan entirely thanks to the particularly profound political trust and boundless loving care shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The noble ideological world and patriotic exploits of Han will always be remembered by posterity along with the history of warm love shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the Chongryon officials and compatriots.

articles.title: Friendship Gathering in Cuba Marks Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Friendship Gathering in Cuba Marks Kim Jong Il's Birthday
						
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A friendship gathering took place in Cuba on Feb. 12 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were personages of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and an international camp and popular masses and the ambassador and officials of the DPRK embassy in Havana.
					
					 The first vice-chairman of the Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification in his speech told about the brief history of Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities and his undying leadership feats. Under his distinguished Songun leadership the DPRK secured tremendous military strength capable of resolutely beating back any aggression by the U.S. imperialists and their allied forces, the speaker said.
					
					 He referred to the DPRK's efforts for peace, security and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 To reunify the peninsula is a vital issue that should be settled in an independent and peaceful way, he said, declaring that they would invariably support the Korean people in the struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Korean Fine Art and Photo Exhibition Opens in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Fine Art and Photo Exhibition Opens in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A Korean fine art and photo exhibition opened in Khabarovsk on Feb. 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, according to ITAR-TASS.
					 The news agency said:
					
					 Displayed on the frontal wall of the exhibition was a portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 On display there were Mannyon paintings which eternally preserve their original colors, handicrafts and pictures drawn by famous Korean painters and photos.
					
					 Photos include those on Kim Jong Il's field guidance to factories, construction sites and farms and inspection of military drill grounds. They show how he is leading the country.

articles.title: Visits to DPRK Missions Paid in Celebration of Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Visits to DPRK Missions Paid in Celebration of Kim Jong Il's Birthday
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Party leaders and personages of different countries visited DPRK missions in their countries between Feb. 10 and 16 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the deputy general secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party and members of the leadership of the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria, the general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) of Nepal, the chairman of the Journalist Association and the president of the National Press Club of Nepal, the chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party, the general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party, the general secretary of the C.C., Socialist Party, the president of the People's League, the chairman of the Institute of the Juche Idea and the chairman of the Group for the Study of the Songun Policy of Bangladesh, the secretary-general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, representatives of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and the president of the "C.I.S. Estero" Group of Italy.
					
					 The visitors laid floral baskets and bouquets before full-length portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Praise Kim Jong Il as Great Man
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Praise Kim Jong Il as Great Man 
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Russia and India carried feature articles with photos of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to celebrate his birthday.
					 Russian newspaper Priamurskie Vedomostsi carried in its Feb. 14th
					
					 issue articles on the greatness of Kim Jong Il under such titles as "February 16, Birthday of Leader of the DPRK Comrade Kim Jong Il, Is National Holiday of the Korean People". 
					
					 In those articles the paper noted that Kim Jong Il successfully carrying forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung has fully shown his disposition as a prominent commander.
					
					 The Feb. 14th  issue of the Indian paper Indian and World Event edited articles titled "Single-minded Unity of the DPRK", "Kimjongilia Festival", etc. under the headline of "On the Occasion of the Birthday of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il". 
					
					 In an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il and His Birthday" the paper said that he travels ceaseless journey of field guidance every year without regarding his birthday and cited facts to prove it.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Jik's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Jik's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A political party of Nepal and an organization of Netherlands praised the feats of Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea.
					 Malodor, an organ of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, carried in its Feb. 11th issue a picture of Kim Hyong Jik and an article titled "Live Up to High Aim!"
					
					 The article noted that when fighters for independence were working hard to achieve the national liberation with help of big countries, he advanced the idea of "Jiwon (aim high)".
					
					 He taught workers, peasants, youth and students and independence champions to win the liberation of the country by the nation itself, closely rallying them, the article notes, adding: He formed the Korean National Association in Hakdang-gol on March 23, 1917.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung carried forward to development the idea of "Jiwon" to pave a new path for the Korean revolution and thanks to the Songun politics of leader Kim Jong Il the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as a socialist power no formidable imperialist enemy dare provoke, it stressed.
					
					 The Dutch Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy posted on its Internet homepage an article introducing Kim Hyong Jik's exploits under the title of "Modern Korea and the Korean National Association".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries between Feb. 10 and 12 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows in Switzerland and Bulgaria and a lecture in Russia.
					
					 On display at their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books and photos on the might of Juche Korea.
					
					 Present at the events were personages of the Swiss preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung, Switzerland-Korea Committee, Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and popular masses.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Glorious Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp", "DPRK Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu" and "Pyongyang Today"
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a meeting in Switzerland.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held Abroad
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Feats Held Abroad
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits of General Secretary Kim Jong Il were held in Russia, Mongolia and India between Feb. 11 and 14 on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The chairwoman of the Kim Jong Suk Women's Union of Russia said that in the DPRK the women's social status and role have been enhanced under the meticulous care of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is a peculiar society in which great advances have been made in all fields under the banner of the Juche idea, the Songun idea, said a member of the Mongolian Association for the Study of Juche Idea-Songun Idea.
					
					 Wipin Gupta, chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India, noted that Kim Jong Il realized the long-cherished desire of the Korean people for leading a dignified life in harmony in a powerful country of independence and formed a harmonious whole between the leader and the people.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a seminar in Russia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Germany 
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Establishing Socialist Cultured Practice in Life to Meet the Need of the Songun Era" was brought out in booklet by the German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association.
					 The work, published on February 10 and July 2, 2003, comprehensively clarifies the importance of establishing cultured practice in life as required by the Songun era and tasks and ways to do so.
					
					 Its releasing ceremony took place in Berlin on Feb. 16.

articles.title: Birthday of Kim Jong Il Marked
articles.content:
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Marked
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Events were held abroad on Feb. 9 and 10 to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included meetings in Germany and Austria, celebrations in Mongolia, round-table talks and film show in Uganda and Korean book and photo exhibition by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement.
					
					 On display at the venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their undying exploits and books and photos introducing the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the C.C., Communist Party of Germany said it is great encouragement to the world progressives that the Korean people are reliably defending the cause of socialism under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Austrian preparatory committee for celebrating February 16 noted that rapid progress has been made in all fields of the economic construction in the DPRK thanks to the devoted activities of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chief of the Kim Jong Il Kindergarten in Darhan Ol Province of Mongolia stressed that the Korean people have achieved signal successes in building a great prosperous and powerful nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, the executive assistant to the general secretary of the Pan-African Movement and other speakers hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater success in the efforts to build a thriving nation and accomplish the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Germany, Austria and Mongolia.

articles.title: Korean People's Efforts for Building Thriving Nation Lauded
articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for Building Thriving Nation Lauded
